name: Tumbledown Mountain

trails_config.name: Brook & Loop Trail
trails_config.description: Maine's most fun hike. Features a chimney scramble ('Fat Man's Misery') and a pristine alpine pond for swimming.
trails_config.parking_info: Brook Trailhead, Byron Rd, Weld, ME

current_conditions.ai_summary: A spectacular hike located in Maine. Standing at 3068 feet, Tumbledown Mountain offers breathtaking views and a rewarding challenge for hikers of all levels.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 3068 feet, Tumbledown Mountain is a standout peak in Maine. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Brook & Loop Trail**, a **5.5 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

This peak stands relatively isolated, offering a solitary summit experience.
